FBLA broke down into groups and each group researched 3 different non-profit organizations that they felt benefited the community of Newport. The students then had to send grant applications out to all the non-profit organizations and patiently wait for them to be returned. Once they were returned the students sorted through them and narrowed them down to their favorites. As a chapter, they then voted on Brighton Center and visited the Scholar House and learned about where the money was going to be used. It was awesome to see the kids get up on stage and talk about how this experience has impacted them, why they chose the Brighton Center, and then they presented the check to Lauren Copeland from the Brighton Center.

Newport Primary School was a recipient of the VSA Art Award. A guest artist came to Newport Primary in March to work with two 2nd grade classes on a fiber lesson. Students were introduced to examples of fabric designs created through dyeing from a variety of cultures: African Tie-Dye, Japanese Shibori, and American Tie-Dye.

The VSA Kentucky Arts Inclusion Program provides experiential, inclusionary arts residencies in all the arts disciplines for Kentucky students of all disabilities. VSA Kentucky's Roster Teaching Artists are trained and mentored to adapt their art forms for children of all abilities before doing VSA Kentucky residencies.

Students manipulated 2 pieces of fabric using rubber bands and then had the opportunity to dye the fabric. Students then sewed the pieces the fabric together to create one-of-a-kind pillows.

The lunchtime digital presentation "What's Up Wildcats!" is now up and running. For those of you that are new to NHS, the Powerpoint presentation loops the entire lunch bell every day.

The presentation includes daily announcements, birthdays, trivia, etc. The project was created to encourage better communication within the student body. We have used the screen in recent years to include core content questions offering multiple choice questions with the answer given on the following day. Please feel free to get creative as we have a captive audience and the students like seeing different content. We can include graphics, photos and of course text.

A "No One FIGHTS Alone!" benefit for Belinda Osborne-Adams will be held on September 26th at the Wilder City Building from 5:00 - 10:00 PM.

Belinda Osborne-Adams has taught in the Newport School System for over 20 years. Most of her career was spent helping special education students. In June 2012, she was diagnosed with Stage 4 Breast Cancer and it had metastasized into Bone Cancer. In May of 2014, they discovered that the cancer had spread to her brain. In June of 2015, the cancer had spread to her spinal fluid and another tumor developed on her spine causing her legs to become too weak to stand.Belinda and her husband Gary are in need of our support. The financial burden of this four-year battle with cancer has become hard to overcome. Please join us at the Team B Benefit to support this amazing woman!

Admission:
$10 Presale / $12 At The Door
Admission includes 2 drink tickets and snacks

There will be raffles, a silent auction, split-the-pot and a bake sale!
